TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ImpersonationLevel extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Describes the impersonation level to be used to connect to WMI.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Management.ImpersonationLevel Anonymous = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Anonymous COM impersonation level that hides the identity of the caller. Calls to WMI may fail with this impersonation level.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Management.ImpersonationLevel Default = int32(0)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Management.ImpersonationLevel Delegate = int32(4)

Docs.summary: Delegate-level COM impersonation level that allows objects to permit other objects to use the credentials of the caller. This level, which will work with WMI calls but may constitute an unnecessary security risk, is supported only under Windows 2000.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Management.ImpersonationLevel Identify = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Identify-level COM impersonation level that allows objects to query the credentials of the caller. Calls to WMI may fail with this impersonation level.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Management.ImpersonationLevel Impersonate = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Impersonate-level COM impersonation level that allows objects to use the credentials of the caller. This is the recommended impersonation level for WMI calls.
